metadata.title: CVE-2022-36021 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. Authenticated userscan use string matching commands (like `SCAN` or `KEYS`) with a speciallycrafted pattern to trigger a denial-of-service attack on Redis, causing itto hang and consume 100% CPU time. The problem is fixed in Redis versions6.0.18, 6.2.11, 7.0.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:7.0.15-1build2
redis-sentinel - 5:7.0.15-1build2
redis-server - 5:7.0.15-1build2
redis-tools - 5:7.0.15-1build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redis package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5:7.0.15-1build2').
